text: Shalom I'm drew and I'm Jewish Salome
I'm Omer and I'm Muslim
[Music]
[Applause]
Uma has hosted me over the last five
days in Sri Lanka and he's become a
great friend the boat 27 loved to travel
and have just about everything in common
except religion I had a bar mitzvah when
I was 13 and I've been to Israel three
times I pray five times a day and I went
on a pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia last
year growing up as a Jew I had a bad
impression of Muslims and I developed a
fear to travel to Muslim countries
growing up as a Muslim people in my
community did not have nice things to
say about Jewish people this is all
nonsense
I can't stand how the media always
portrays the extremists to represent
each community as a whole as I've
traveled all over the world and made
hundreds of Muslim friends I've realized
that Judaism and Islam have very similar
traditions rituals and values we're
having a traditional meal in Newark shad
Mauritania we both believe in one God
and have matching views of his presence
and creations both religions have a holy
book the Torah and the Quran
we're both interpretations of that texts
have become sacred we are both
family-oriented people we wear small
hats on our heads and have our biggest
prayers on Friday night Judaism and
Islam both regard Jerusalem as a holy
City Temple Mount is the sacred side of
the Western Wall that remains of our
second temple and it also contains a
third holiest site in Islam the al-aqsa
mosque both Jews and Muslims have
similar food restrictions kosher and
halal
remember in these diets animals must be
slaughtered a certain way and eating
pork is forbidden our founding languages
Arabic and Hebrew share common
vocabulary words and we both read from
right to left we all see on the news
that both religions have a potential for
violence but those violent people make
up point zero zero one percent of our
communities I hope that learning about
the similarities between Judaism and
Islam can be a stable foundation for
building a bridge to connect our members
so please let Amara and I be an example
for how a Muslim and a Jew can perfectly
get along in today's world despite what
anyone may tell you drew so maybe next
time we meet it to be in Israel
yeah or Saudi Arabia I'd love to go
there oh I love that man but regardless
let's stay in touch forever
[Music]
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
